intro: Pilosella firmicaulis, commonly known as the slender pilosella, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, commonly known as the daisy or sunflower family. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that are typically grouped in dense, spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving the plant a soft, fuzzy appearance. Pilosella firmicaulis is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
